agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides community outreach services, including limited financial assistance.
service_description: Provides limited financial assistance for rent and utilities (electric, water/sewer, and gas), and food vouchers to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Call for information or to request assistance; leave a voicemail with name, phone number, and type of assistance needed.
site_eligibility: Living in Clay County -- Rent or utility bill must be in applicant's name -- Limit total assistance up to $100 per household per every 12 months

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides transportation to medical appointments for area veterans to the veterans' hospital or clinic in Indianapolis or Terre Haute, Indiana. Vehicle is not wheelchair accessible.
site_details: Call at least 7 days in advance.
site_eligibility: Veterans living in Clay County -- With an appointment at the veterans' hospital or clinic in Indianapolis or Terre Haute, Indiana
Veteran -- surviving spouses -- children of a veteran

agency_name: SAINT VINCENT DE PAUL CLAY COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization located in the Annunciation Catholic Church with charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
site_name: SAINT VINCENT DE PAUL CLAY COUNTY
service_description: Provides assistance for those in need of rent, utility, or prescription assistance. Gasoline vouchers may be available. Assistance is limited to once per year. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in during designated hours, or call for initial assessment. -- A volunteer will schedule a home visit.
site_eligibility: Living in Clay County -- Not received assistance from this agency in the past year
Living in Clay County -- Limit one visit per month

agency_desc: A nonprofit health network with a Catholic perspective offering hospitals, physicians, and specialty services throughout central and southern Indiana.
service_description: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
site_details: Walk in for emergency care. Call for additional information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit child care center offering parenting education workshops to parents.
service_description: Offers a parenting education workshop once a month to parents
site_details: Call to register.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions

site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_name: FAMILY SUPPORT SERVICES OF WEST CENTRAL INDIANA
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides education, intervention, and supportive services, including domestic violence and sexual assault victim advocacy, healthy families, and the Putnam County Recovery Coalition.
site_name: FAMILY SUPPORT SERVICES OF WEST CENTRAL INDIANA - CLAY COUNTY
service_name: DOMESTIC VIOLENCE AND SEXUAL ASSAULT PROGRAM - CLAY COUNTY
service_description: Provides support, education, and advocacy to men and women who have been victims of violence. Services include court advocacy, protective orders, safe shelter, domestic violence education, safety plans, referrals, support groups, on-going support, educational groups, and awareness programming.
site_details: Call and ask for advocate. -- For after hours emergencies, call 9-1-1, 765-655-1295, or county dispatch.

site_schedule.name: General Crime Victim Assistance
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- After hours emergencies: Daily 24 hours

site_schedule.name: Protective/Restraining Orders
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- After hours emergencies: Daily 24 hours

site_schedule.name: Case/Care Management
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- After hours emergencies: Daily 24 hours

site_schedule.name: Specialized Information and Referral
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- After hours emergencies: Daily 24 hours

site_eligibility: Female, male, or transgender -- Direct and indirect victims of domestic violence

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides services to alleviate poverty, improve living conditions, and provide access to health care and social services to those in need.
site_name: WESTERN INDIANA COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY - CLAY COUNTY
service_description: Provides free weatherization for moderate- to low-income homeowners and renters. Services may include attic insulation, weather-stripping, and foundation, heat duct, and water pipe insulation. Furnace repair or replacement may be provided in some cases.
site_details: Call for initial phone assessment.
site_eligibility:
○Living in Clay, Putnam, or Vigo County
○Household income at or below 200% Federal Poverty Guidelines

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
site_name: UNION HOSPITAL - CLAY CITY CENTER FOR FAMILY MEDICINE
service_description: Provides comprehensive family medicine services including family planning, physicals (work, school, and sport), vision care, and laboratory services. Sliding-scale fees are available for income-eligible clients.
site_details: Existing Patients: Call for an appointment; same day appointments may be available. -- New Patients: Generally must submit records from previous medical provider prior to first appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A 24-hour crisis intervention agency that provides inpatient and outpatient behavioral health care; mental health and addictions treatment for all ages.
service_name: OUTPATIENT MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES - CLAY COUNTY
service_description: Provides individual, group, couple, and family counseling for adults, adolescents, and children on a walk-in basis. Also offers psychiatric and psychological assessment, consultation, and treatment services. A 24-hour crisis line is available, with referrals to locations in Clay, Greene, Parke, Putnam, Sullivan, Vermillion, and Vigo County.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call the office for information or to a schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open (minimum age served determined by individual assessment) -- Living in Clay, Owen, Parke, Putnam, Sullivan, or Vigo county

agency_desc: A government agency that provides health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides routine health and safety inspections and investigates complaints against restaurants, grocery stores, and other food service establishments in the County. Provides consultation and licensing for retail food service vendors and food safety education for individuals, health fairs, and community groups.
site_details: Call to make a complaint about licensed food service establishments in the County or for details about licensing or food safety programs.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Clay County
Open
Living within the county
Schools, community organizations, and other groups in the County

Living within the County -- Age 2 months through 18 years-old -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

Living within the county -- Testing is recommended for any child 6 months through 6 years old who: Lives in or visits a building constructed before 1978 -Or- lives with someone who works with lead (such as a battery factory, steel smelter, stained glass) -OR- has a sibling or playmate who has been diagnosed with lead poisoning.
Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate
Age 19 or older
Varies by service; call for information.
Age 6 months and older

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Clay County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime prevention, and criminal investigation services and administers county correctional facilities in Clay County. A ten-digit dispatch number is provided for nonemergency dispatch calls. For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police, fire, or medical assistance. For nonemergency requests or reports, call the office during normal business hours. nonemergency dispatch number.

site_schedule.name: Sheriff
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- County Dispatch: Daily 24 hours

site_schedule.name: Non-Emergency Crime Reporting
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- County Dispatch: Daily 24 hours

site_eligibility: Open; serves Clay County
To visit: Must be on the inmate's approved visitor list -- Age 18 or older (or accompanied by someone over 18 who is also on the inmate's visitor list)

agency_name: CHRISTIAN CARE AND SHARE SERVICES OF SOUTHERN CLAY COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides outreach services, including a food pantry and thrift store.
site_name: CHRISTIAN CARE AND SHARE SERVICES OF SOUTHERN CLAY COUNTY
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food and frozen meat to persons in need.  Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living within the following boundaries in Clay County: N-I-70/42; S-Greene County Line;   E-Owen County Line; W-Vigo County Line -- Not visited this pantry within the past 30 days
Living in Clay County -- Assistance eligibility is once in a 365-day period -- Per assessment

agency_name: CHRISTIAN CARE AND SHARE SERVICES OF SOUTHERN CLAY COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides outreach services, including a food pantry and thrift store.
service_description: Sells donated clothing (baby through adult sizes), shoes, coats, household goods, dishes, and small kitchenware at discounted prices. Small furniture items are sometimes available. Proceeds from the thrift store support programs through Christian Care and Share Services of Southern Clay County.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing transportation and a food pantry for older adults and those with disabilities.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.

site_schedule.name: Disability Related Transportation
site_schedule.schedule:
- Within Brazil: Tues and Wed 8am-3pm
- To and from Terre Haute: Fri 8am-3pm

site_schedule.name: Non-Emergency Medical Transportation
site_schedule.schedule:
- Within Brazil: Tues and Wed 8am-3pm
- To and from Terre Haute: Fri 8am-3pm

site_schedule.name: Senior Ride Programs
site_schedule.schedule:
- Within Brazil: Tues and Wed 8am-3pm
- To and from Terre Haute: Fri 8am-3pm

site_eligibility: Living in Clay County -- Limit one visit per month
Open

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in Clay County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic laws, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
site_details: Call for more information
site_eligibility: Open
Victims and witnesses of major crimes in Clay County

To File for Child Support Assistance: Living in Clay County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child

agency_desc: A nonprofit, community-based food and clothing pantry serving all in need.
service_description: Offers donated clothing of all sizes, coats, shoes, kitchenware, small kitchen appliances, and bedding to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in; arrive by 10:45am
site_eligibility: Living in Clay County -- Limit one visit per week
Living in Clay County -- Limit one visit every 30 days

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Provides a comprehensive special education program for students with disabilities in the Clay Community School Corporation. Services range from consultation to resource rooms to self-contained classrooms, depending on the individual needs of the student.
site_details: Call for information about special education services.
site_eligibility: Living in the Clay Community School District -- Ages 3-22 -- With any form of disability that requires special education services (determined by assessment)

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Offers instruction in basic language arts, math, reading, science, and social studies as well as preparation for the high school equivalency test. Morning and evening classes available throughout the year.
site_details: Call or walk in to register.

site_schedule.name: GED/High School Equivalency Test Sites
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Thurs 8:30am-1:30pm; Tues and Thurs 4pm-6pm -- Testing: Vary

site_eligibility: Ages 16 and older -- Not enrolled in high school (documentation required for ages 16-17)

Have lived in Indiana for at least 30 days -- Age 18 or older (recommended); ages 16-17 may be eligible to take the test  with a letter of recommendation signed by a superintendent of an Indiana public  school system -- Not enrolled in high school

agency_desc: Provides direct assistance and referrals for Clay County persons in need through a network of individuals, churches, and social organizations.
service_description: Assists persons in need with utility, rent, and food expenses. Eligibility is determined on a case-by-case basis through an interview process. Assistance is dependent on available funds. Offers referral to other social service agencies.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Financial need determined by assessment -- Not received assistance from this agency within the past year -- Not living in government assisted housing -- Must have applied for assistance from township trustee first

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services.
service_description: Provides water, sanitary sewer, and trash services for the city of Brazil in Clay County.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Services
site_details: Walk in to establish new service or call for information. -- Bills may be paid online, in person, by mail, or by phone; a drop box is located at this address. -- To report water leaks after hours, call the Brazil Police Department at (812) 446-221.

site_schedule.name: City/County Parks
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 7am-3pm -- Parks: Daily dawn to dusk, unless otherwise noted

site_eligibility: Open
Varies by service; services limited to properties within Brazil city limits
Parks are open to all; some programs may have specific requirements

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services.
service_description: Provides street and sidewalk maintenance, storm-sewer maintenance, snow and ice control, dead animal pick-up, street-sign maintenance, trash/recycling, and groundskeeping of public properties in the city of Brazil in Clay County.
site_details: Call for information, to submit a request, or to make a report; street or sidewalk service request available on website.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in Clay County.
service_description: Issues, provides, and maintains  marriage licenses issued in the county. No witnesses, blood tests, or waiting period are required to obtain one. Both applicants must appear at the time of application. Marriages must take place within 60 days of the marriage license being issued.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Walk in. Marriage license forms may be completed in advance online or in the clerk's office.

site_schedule.name: Child Support Assistance/Enforcement
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm

site_schedule.name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices

site_eligibility: Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county
Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election
Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support
Varies by service; serves Clay County

agency_desc: A government agency that administers housing assistance programs.
service_description: Provides subsidized, income-based rental units to eligible families and persons who are elderly or disabled.  A wait list is maintained when all units are full. Rent amount is equal to 30% of the resident's adjusted gross income.
site_details: Call, mail, email or apply online
site_eligibility: Meet low-income guidelines from eligible income sources such as employment, pension, Social Security, SSI, SSDI -- No rent or judgments owed to any Public Housing Authority -- Satisfactory criminal history; ask for details
Household income below set limits -- Preference given to families with children, seniors, and people with disabilities

agency_desc: Coordinates emergency management programs and response measures in Clay County.
service_description: Responds during a disaster or large-scale emergency in Clay County, assists with the recovery efforts afterwards, and takes steps to prevent or lessen the effects of future disasters. Offers empty bags to be filled with sand to prevent flood damage.
site_details: Call for information. For emergency assistance, call 9-1-1.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Clay County

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Clay County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority fortheir respectivecounty, including performing the following duties:controls, maintains, and supervises county property; audits and authorizes claims against the county; receives bids for and authorizes county contracts; performs certain election functions; handlesappealof township trustee decisions.
site_details: Call for assistance.

site_schedule.name: General Relief Appeals/Complaints
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st Mon 9am

site_schedule.name: Local Officials Offices
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st Mon 9am

site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: Provides emergency fire and medical services in the city of Brazil in Clay County.
service_description: Responds to fire, emergency medical, hazardous material, and special rescue situations in the city of Brazil in Clay County. Persons in need of emergency services should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours.
site_eligibility: Open; responds to emergency situations in the city of Brazil
Homeowner or renters -- Financial need

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Brazil in Clay County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Brazil in Clay County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Brazil in Clay County

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property Clay County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Clay County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information. www.claycountyin.gov
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Clay County

agency_desc: Provides maintenance services on county roads and streets.
service_description: Maintains county roadways in Clay County, including patching, paving, snow removal, street sweeping, roadside mowing, and drainage along roadways.
site_details: Call for information or to report a problem. To report urgent problems after hours, call 9-1-1 or Clay County dispatch.
site_eligibility: Open (limited to county roads and properties in Clay County)

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
site_name: CLAY COUNTY CIRCUIT AND SUPERIOR COURT
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including juvenile and family cases, in Clay County.
site_details: Call or walk in
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $6,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Clay County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Clay County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Clay County
Offenders assigned to probation by the Clay County Courts

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering various social, recreational, and fitness programs.
service_description: Offers programs for all ages, including all-season sports, weight-lifting, swimming lessons, and water aerobics. Members pay dues for open access to the fitness center, fitness classes, and pool and receive discounted rates for special programs. Nonmembers pay fixed fees for classes.
site_details: Walk in or visit the website to join or register for specific programs; membership application can be printed from the website.
site_eligibility: Open; membership not required for most programs, but members do receive discounts on fees.

agency_desc: Provides shelter for unwanted and stray animals in Clay County.
service_description: Provides shelter for stray and unwanted animals in Clay County and rehomes animals through adoption. Offers lost-and-found services, microchipping of pets, and spay/neuters services.
site_details: For lost or found pets: Call or walk in as soon as possible -- For adoptions: Walk in -- For animal surrenders: Call to see if space is available.

site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Tues, and Thurs noon-4pm; Fri noon-5pm; Sat noon-6pm

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food, paper products, and laundry detergent to people in need. Open service area.
site_details: Walk in.

site_schedule.schedule: Monthly last Wed 2pm-3:30pm-- Nov and Dec: 3rd Wed 2pm-3:30pm

site_schedule.schedule: Monthly last Wed 2pm-3:30pm-- Nov and Dec: 3rd Wed 2pm-3:30pm

site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach programs, including a weekly meal.
service_description: Offers a weekly evening meal for persons in need.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as: Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
